column4: Would you mind giving me a hand as well with a simple network issue?
sure. I'll try to help both you and neverblue at the some time.

Great, thank you! Long story short. I am working with netbook edition. Have been able to connect to the network before, but now I can't. Well it does say I am connected, but cannot ping the router, it is unreachable.
What do you get when you type "route" into a terminal
Looks like I am connected to an I.P. that is not my routers.
sorry, missed your last message there for a minute... What is the first 2 numbers of the IP shown?
I can ping it from the netbook but not from another computer.
On the netbook that can ping... What are the first two numbers of the IP address it reports from the network manager?
hmm something strange. Under /etc/network/interfaces it does not show
hmm something strange. Under /etc/network/interfaces it does not show "eth1"
Ethernet cards should start with eth0.
ifconfig is showing 2. eth0 and eth1, which neither are located in that file.
I think that network/interfaces is just for setting up static networking. Like for servers and stuff like that.
No. Mine doesn't list my interfaces either and it's working fine
What are the first two numbers of the IP address that your working computer reports in the network manager?
